column2: A corral devoted to the training and housing of warhorses has been constructed to permanently garrison sturdy mounted knights within this settlement.
column4: Ein Reitgelände, auf dem die Ritter sich im Kampf üben und auf dem Kriegspferden zugeritten werden.

column2: This retinue of mounted knights has become fiercer and quite large, and it is a force capable of slaying and trampling a retinue of similar size.
column4: Die Stallungen bieten Platz für Dutzende Schlachtrösser und die Unterstützung durch Stallburschen erlaubt den Rittern, mehr Zeit im eigentlichen Training zu verbringen.

column2: These stables are dedicated to war. The warhorses and men that ride them are truly a force to be reckoned with.
column4: Auf dem Turnierplatz trainieren Woche für Woche Scharen von Rittern für den Ernstfall, auf dass die Feinde des Königreichs im Staub vergehen.

column2: The knights borne and trained in these corrals are borderline superhuman, thanks to the hearty, fierce and beast-like mounts they ride into battle.
column4: Nur die Besten der Besten unter den Rittern, die Sieger der Turniere, dürfen auf diesem Platz trainieren. Wer hier den Sieg davon trägt, ist ein wahrer Streiter des Lichts.

column2: Small groups of mages have come together to found and construct a small enchanted outcropping where hedge mages and rogue casters can come and congregate.
column4: Eine kleine Gruppe von Magiern hat sich an diesem verzauberten Ort niedergelassen, an dem sich seit jeher Zauberkünstler und Mystiker versammelt haben.

column2: The previously disorganized group of mages have built, or rather summoned, a large stone tower acting as a magical foci and repository for arcane knowledge.
column4: Die zuvor unorganisierte Gruppe von Magiern hat einen großen steinernen Turm errichtet, der als Aufbewahrungsort für arkanes Wissen fungiert.

column2: This tower of the arcane draws upon untold amounts of ley energy in the area, further empowering the mages that find their home and family within.
column4: Dieser Turm des Arkanen schöpft aus einer unfassbar großen Menge an Ley-Energie und stärkt die Magier, die dort ihre Heimat und Familie finden.

column2: A grand pinnacle surging with raw arcane energy finds itself having changed the environment around it. The flora and fauna find themselves rather enchanted and magical spells are heavily empowered.
column4: Eine gewaltige Zinne, die vor roher arkaner Energie strotzt, hat die Umgebung um sich herum verändert. Sowohl in der Tier- als auch der Pflanzenwelt lässt sich der magische Einfluss entdecken und sämtliche Zaubersprüche werden verstärkt.

column2: A small cloister of human monks has been founded within the temple here with some of the monks being knowledgeable in the magical arts.
column4: Im Tempel wurde hier ein Kreuzgang von menschlichen Mönchen errichtet, in dem einige der Mönche über Kenntnisse in der magischen Kunst verfügen.

column2: More religious minded men and women have gathered to form a convent within the temple, bringing greater prestige and piety to the local abbot and liege.
column4: Religiösere Männer und Frauen haben sich versammelt, um eine Abtei im Tempel zu gründen und dem örtlichen Abt und Lehnsherrn mehr Prestige und Frömmigkeit zu bringen.

column2: Separate from the primary temple, an isolated abbey has been constructed to better house the more devout worshipers of the area.
column4: Abseits des Haupttempels wurde eine isolierte Abtei errichtet, um die frommsten Gläubigen der Gegend besser unterzubringen.

column2: Perhaps reigning in the most prestige, a grand monastery stands gilded and royal isolated away from most of civilization.
column4: Vielleicht am prestigeträchtigsten regierend, steht ein großes Kloster vergoldet und königlich isoliert von einem Großteil der Zivilisation.

column2: Magical shops selling enchanted baubles, wands, and enchanting materials have opened throughout the settlement bringing a rather niche market to an otherwise drab marketplace.
column4: Magische Geschäfte, die verzauberte Kugeln, Stäbe und bezaubernde Materialien verkaufen,sind überall in der Siedlung zu finden und bringen Abwechslung auf einen ansonsten tristen Marktplatz.

column2: Centralized around the mage shops and industry, a large portal hall has been constructed allowing for quick travel around the city and the region.
column4: Zentral um die Magierläden und die Industrie herum wurde eine große Portalhalle errichtet, die eine schnelle Reise durch die Stadt und die Region ermöglicht.

column2: Quarters specifically built for magical research and housing has been built in this part of the settlement
column4: In diesem Teil der Siedlung wurden Quartiere gebaut, die speziell für die magische Erforschung und Unterbringung der Zauberer errichtet wurden.

column2: A large portion of the city has been dedicated to the magical arts, research, culture, and industry, drastically changing the dynamic of every citizen in town.
column4: Ein großer Teil der Stadt ist den magischen Künsten, der Forschung, der Kultur und der Industrie gewidmet und hat das Leben eines jeden Bürgers in der Stadt grundlegend verändert.

column2: A part of the city has been dedicated for recreational use through the construction of a moderately sized park.
column4: Ein Teil der Stadt wurde dem Bau eines Parks für die Erholung gewidmet.

column2: Community members have begun managing gardens and other activities within the park grounds.
column4: Die Gemeindemitglieder haben mit der Bewirtschaftung von Gärten und anderen Aktivitäten auf dem Parkgelände begonnen.

column2: Herbalists and alchemists alike have found good business within the city by utilizing the city park as a source of well-grown natural herbs and ingredients.
column4: Kräuterkundige und Alchemisten haben in der Stadt gute Geschäfte entdeckt, indem sie den Stadtpark als Quelle für wohlgezüchtete natürliche Kräuter und Zutaten nutzen.

column2: A large section of the city has been portioned off to make room for a large park district, home to herbalists, alchemists, and other natural arts.
column4: Ein großer Teil der Stadt wurde abgetrennt, um Platz für ein großes Parkviertel zu schaffen, in dem Kräuterkundige, Alchemisten und andere Naturkünstler leben.

column2: Grunts are orcish warriors, who due to their immense strength and blood lust were unmatched in open combat to conventional armies. This mustering field helps organize a gathering of these warriors.

Grunts are orcish warriors, who due to their immense strength and blood lust were unmatched in open combat to conventional armies. Combined clans are housed within this barracks, sharing their martial skill.

Grunts are orcish warriors, who due to their immense strength and blood lust were unmatched in open combat to conventional armies. This main clan gathering of weapons and armor greatly improves the skill and blood lust of these clan warriors.

Grunts are orcish warriors, who due to their immense strength and blood lust were unmatched in open combat to conventional armies. A small district dedicated to a warrior orc clan, serviced by peons and well stocked with weapons, forges, and feasting halls.
Worgs play an important part in Orc culture, used as mounts and as pets. These partially, but barely, natural dens allow orcs access to these powerful beasts.
column4: Worge spielen eine wichtige Rolle in der Ork-Kultur, die sie als Reittiere und Haustiere verwenden. Diese teilweise, aber nur selten natürlichen Höhlen ermöglichen Orks den Zugang zu diesen mächtigen Tieren.

column2: A corral with many beast cages which many beast masters of the orc clans tame beasts for economic, but mostly war, purposes.
column4: Ein Gehege mit vielen Tierkäfigen, die viele Bestienmeister der Ork-Clans für wirtschaftliche, aber meist kriegerische Zwecke zähmen.

column2: A large complex of beast cages and pits which numerous large creatures are tamed by the orc clans for war and conflict.
column4: Ein großer Komplex von Tierkäfigen und Gruben, in denen zahlreiche große Kreaturen von den Ork-Clans für Krieg und Konflikt gezähmt werden.

column2: A vast complex of beast cages, with countless chained beasts which are tamed by teams of peons and beast masters for war and conflict.
column4: Ein gewaltiger Komplex von Tierkäfigen, mit unzähligen angeketteten Tieren, die von Teams von Peons und Bestienmeistern für Krieg und Konflikt gezähmt werden.

column2: Hovels made for and by the peon caste of orcs, runts of orc clans who do the hard labor for their hordes, treated as little more then slaves.
column4: Mehrere Peons des Lagers haben begonnen, sich niederzulassen und Zelte um die Mauern der Siedlung herum aufzustellen.

column2: Protective borrows for orc peons in which they made hide and throw out javelins at incoming attackers who try to disrupt their work
column4: Die wenigen Zelte sind zu ausgewachsenen Lagern geworden, während die Bevölkerung der Siedlung zu explodieren beginnt.

column2: A large mill and smithy, in which a large group of peon deforest the local landscape of it's resources to help build up the local orc settlements
column4: Da sie nicht in der Lage sind, sich stabil aufzubauen, haben unsere Peons stattdessen damit begonnen, sich in der Erde niederzulassen, da sie sich nicht auf unsere Mauern zur Verteidigung verlassen können.

column2: A massive district dedicated to penning in the Peon caste of orcs, these slavish cretins build the vast war industry of the orcs, safe within their walled off districts.
column4: Die sich schlängelnden Straßen der Slums beherbergen unsere Peons innerhalb und außerhalb unserer Siedlung und schaffen eine schier endlose Anzahl von Arbeitskräften, die wir an jeden beliebigen Ort leiten können.

column2: A fighting pit where orc warriors prove their mettle by fighting for honor, glory, and gold
An arena where a number of orc champions, and the occasional slave gladiator, fights to the death in front of a bloodthirsty orc crowd.
A sizable orc stadium, which houses a sizable group of gladiators who fight and die for the bloodthirsty amusement of orc crowds, occasionally having to fight off the crowd itself.
A barbarous gladiatorial colosseum where many orc warriors and their gladiators counterparts take part in hundreds of bloodthirsty games.
A barbarous shrine dedicated to a elemental lord or being worshiped by the orcs as a god or divine spirit
A spacious holy cavern where orc shamans commune with their lords, and where orc magi study their magic in relative peace
A strongly magical cavern where a community of orcish dark wizards and their students conduct foul magic in both secrecy and peace, away from other orc communities
A strong near demonic shrine infused with powerful magic, used as a foci to empower magic and to even bring back the dead.
Several dwarven riflemen are outfitted from the weapons stored in this depot. It isn't much, but it's enough to keep the riflemen stocked for days at a time.
This armory is outfitted with several ranks of weaponry and equipment for dwarven soldiers to take advantage of. Not even the largest Trogg could break in.
Next to keeping the dwarven riflemen stocked and equipped, this range gives them room and tools to practice with in order to be better prepared for any hostile incursion

These multi-level barracks house hundreds of dwarven riflemen ready to defend their kin to the last. The stockpiles of weapons and resources kept here gives this barracks the ability to hold out for several weeks.
Several caverns have been excavated by the dwarves here to give room for urban expansion, military garrisons, and general economic activities.
The cavern holds here have expanded to encompass multiple levels, entrances, and exits throughout the mountainous terrain in this area. The dwarves here entrench themselves further every day.
The expansive caverns that the dwarves have excavated here are practically a fortress in their own right, with the Earth Mother's mountains acting as their bastion.

Dwarves have excavated and erected a metropolis-sized hub of economic and military activity right under the earth. Any passerby would be unaware of the bustling activity churning away under the surface of the mountain ranges in this area.
Dwarven miners have started to dig away at the earth and stone in this region, and their efforts are starting to give way to precious and practical metals.
Mining efforts have increased tenfold as the earth gives way to dwarven ambition. Tons of stone, metal and gemstones exits these mines on a daily basis.
Minters have set up shop in this region, thriving off the rich pulls dwarves make daily from Azeroth's crust.

Famous dwarven mining guilds have made their presence known, finding opportunity and profit in the subterranean operations that threaten to break the crust. Multitudes of precious metals and gemstones flow from dwarven mining shafts deep within the earth.
Dwarves have constructed a museum dedicated to the display and pursuit of knowledge. Commoners frequent it and dwarf-kind benefits as a whole.
Archaeologists have formed a local guild completely dedicated to pursuing historical knowledge that can be used to further develop dwarven civilization.

An emporium of historical relics and treasures can be found in this dwarven city. They are marked from ages long past in Azeroth's history, bringing astonishment to every pair of dwarven eyes that crosses them.
An entire academy dedicated to historical knowledge and teachings has been constructed by the local dwarven guilds.
An dwarven excavation has begun here, though it is not one that's in search of precious metals and jewels. There's an inkling of titan ruins beneath the surface.
Small chambers have been excavating giving way to what appears to be constructed by the titans, the forefathers of the dwarves themselves.
An entire titan disc library has been successfully excavated by the dwarves here. The age-old technical documents found within are already being applied to dwarven designs.

The titans constructed an entire vault of knowledge beneath the earth, and the dwarves of this region were just lucky and resourceful enough to excavate it and live to tell the tale. The knowledge unearthed is invaluable.
Dwarves have erected a shrine to the elements in order to better venerate their dwarven ancestors and commune with the earthen elements surging through their subterranean settlements.
A portion of the temple grounds here have been dedicated to ancestor veneration and the spirits of the mountains and earth.
An entire structure has been built to give lodging to those dedicated to the elements, further empowering our elemental spell casters.
A grand complex to the elements dominates this section of the settlement. Whistling, rumbling, and other natural omens permeate the area and all those who are around to hear and see its spectacles.
Tuskarr hunters are trained in the art of trapping and befriending the local turtle population.
A greater effort is made into trapping some of the larger sea turtles and equipping the turtles with armor where they aren't covered by their shells.
Extensive efforts are made with breeding a larger turtle population, which will serve the proud Kalu'ak well.
A huge War Turtle breeding and equipping complex, maintaining several levels of turtles in various sizes, from Kalu'ak turtle ships to armored war turtles.
Some Tuskarr are trained in the art producing equipment from whale leather.
The local tuskarrs are trained in the making of bone char, which provides them with this new option to stoke the fires of industry.
The industry around the Tuskarrs bone char is expanding, to meet the needs of an ever expanding Tuskarr industry.
A vast complex around the Kalu'ak Bone char furnaces are producing armaments for the brave Tuskarr armies.
Tuskarr spell-casters are often attended by small parties of javelin throwers, driving enemies towards the spell-casters.
A small gathering of several smaller Kalu'ak statues attended by the local spell-casters.
A larger amount of Tuskarr stone statues are lined along local roadways.
A colossal Tuskarr statue towers over the nearby castle.
To the Tuskarr family is everything, with a small shrine that the Kalu'ak can gather new knowledge might be uncovered.
The strong bond of kin, naturally leads the conversation that the casters of Kalu'ak to protect their tribe.
A construction of a meeting hall around the shrine will further enhance further studies.
An extensive meeting hall with where the Kalu'ak can discuss.
Instead of forming larger raiding parties the Tuskarr prefers to send out trappers towards the local penguin population.
Designated areas are left alone for the local penguins except when they are needed for food.
Large areas of water and land are fenced in, allowing the penguins to still catch fish but prevents them from escaping.
Extensive fences around the local penguins allows the Tuskarr to extract eggs and food at leisure.
Tuskarr treat visitors bringing fish as great as long lost relatives, this hospitality must be the cornerstone of Tuskarr towns.
The knights of Stormwind fight with the old blood of Arathor, protecting humankind from Troll and Orc alike. This encampment helps train and recruit new members.
The knights of Stormwind fight with the old blood of Arathor, protecting humankind from Troll and Orc alike. A barracks where the 7th Legion is stationed and trains.

The knights of Stormwind fight with the old blood of Arathor, protecting humankind from Troll and Orc alike. A specialized keep not made for nobles, but for commanders and officers made to be a forward base on possible battlefronts.

The knights of Stormwind fight with the old blood of Arathor, protecting humankind from Troll and Orc alike. A veteran's district and informal pension where legionary families can train new generations for the 7th Legion in relative military luxury.
A small civilian quarter of free practicing mages and conjurers which live under the close protection of a Azerothian lord.
Mage Towers were a staple of the great wars and a common sight in Azerothian counties, which hosted powerful individual mages and their apprentices.
A guild a local mages joined together to specialize their craft, earn an income together, and perfect their skills.
Similar to a magic school, these keeps act like specialized guild halls which help new mages study arcane arts and use them to establish new businesses in nearby cities.

Azerothian Militias are a sizable armed force dedicated to defending their lands and patrolling for danger. Holdouts are more akin to distant makeshift family halls where younger militias are armed and organized.

Azerothian Militias are a sizable armed force dedicated to defending their lands and patrolling for danger. Halls are located in town halls or urban centers, which help recruit and organize the Militias.

Azerothian Militias are a sizable armed force dedicated to defending their lands and patrolling for danger. Militia Towers are taken over outlying towers which have been abandoned, but rearmed and used as a headquarters by the Militias.

Azerothian Militias are a sizable armed force dedicated to defending their lands and patrolling for danger. High ground towers with minor fortifications which acts as barracks, headquarters, and armory for a well organized militia.
Azerothian Lighthouses prevent trade ships from crashing into rocky shores and guide ships through fog.
A local naval garrison which protect the naval port, but also helps with important wharf tasks which speeds along ship building and protection.
Azerothian noble involvement in the sea trade is a normality, who build and expand upon existing wharfs with new warehouses and shipyards.
The Royal Marina is a Stormwind invention of massive expansive dockyards supported by various shipyards and trade wharfs, second only to Kul Tiras.

Bishops are elite religious officials above the station of priest in Azerothian religious hierarchy, and are masters of defensive magic. Offices dedicated to these religious elites helps them administer theological issues with ease.

Bishops are elite religious officials above the station of priest in Azerothian religious hierarchy, and are masters of defensive magic. Theological library which provides a more modern and useful study of religion, and helps train new acolytes.

Bishops are elite religious officials above the station of priest in Azerothian religious hierarchy, and are masters of defensive magic. A theological mission which helps prepare new priests and religious warriors under the guidance of bishop support.

Bishops are elite religious officials above the station of priest in Azerothian religious hierarchy, and are masters of defensive magic. A religious palace which acts as a home for a council of bishops and their priestly covenant.

Azerothian legions are early armed forces of later renditions, made up of well trained civilian armies which are rigorously trained. This encampment, pitched on high ground, helps train and recruit new members.
Azerothian legions are early armed forces of later renditions, made up of well trained civilian armies which are rigorously trained. A small palliside surrounding a city of legionary tents.

Azerothian legions are early armed forces of later renditions, made up of well trained civilian armies which are rigorously trained. A small fortified hilltop complete with towers, which protects a organized encampment of Azerothian legionaries.

Azerothian legions are early armed forces of later renditions, made up of well trained civilian armies which are rigorously trained. A wooden walled barracks with a stone base, which provides housing and an armory for Azerothian legions.
A well furnished hut fit for minor nobles and their families.
A militarized hut with a noble and family and their militia, which is well paid off.
A well organized manor and fiefdom of a Azerothian noble family and their expanded farmstead.
A rich household of a minor noble family and their personal fiefdom. While technically little more than a overglorified warlord, their loyalty is unquestioned.
A well furnished internal embassy of a local branch of the republic which caters to families of disenfranchised nobles.
A council of nobility given trivial titles and powers which grants the illusion of control.
An extravagent apartment which young nobles come to party and meet with republican families to get drunk and discuss politics.
An informal palace far in some poetic countryside where nobles gather to party under the watchful eye of the guild and engage in bread and games for the nobility.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad captains are famed for being well armored, well trained, and their unflinching loyalty. A local noble's fiefdom made up of the family of the captains and a training center for them provided by their family ties.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad captains are famed for being well armored, well trained, and their unflinching loyalty. Schools which help train new officers in battlefield tactics and improved base management.
Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad captains are famed for being well armored, well trained, and their unflinching loyalty. An academy dedicated solely to studying new military tactics.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad captains are famed for being well armored, well trained, and their unflinching loyalty. A royal barracks where elite royal guards are promoted among captains into a single military elite vanguard.
Lordaeron's horses were famed for their strength and agility, their corrals funded by high nobility.
A ranching complex of royal ranchers who dedicated themselves fully to creating better warhorses for knights and royalty.
A minor local Tournament where mounted Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad men will compete in combat for fame and fortune.
A formal and large scale game ground for knights and nobles to engage in mounted combat for both entertainment and for prestige.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad huntsmen are an organized unit of war dogs, longbows, and engineers which work well in the forests of Lordaeron's home country. Ranges help the huntsmen perfect their aim, especially at long ranges.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad huntsmen are an organized unit of war dogs, longbows, and engineers which work well in the forests of Lordaeron's home country. A dedicated barracks where Huntsmen train and house in relative peace.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad huntsmen are an organized unit of war dogs, longbows, and engineers which work well in the forests of Lordaeron's home country. A more dedicated complex of beast trainers and ranges which perfect the Huntsmen regiments.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad huntsmen are an organized unit of war dogs, longbows, and engineers which work well in the forests of Lordaeron's home country. A formal barracks and armory which houses various new ranged inventions and gear which creates a better outfit for Huntsmen.
Individuals from Lordaeron and Hillsbrad have a small but powerful love of tobacco and have a thriving pipe industry, helped by specialized pipe craftsmen such as this one.
A private weapon maker who makes maces, guns, and swords for those willing to buy.
A guild of mailers who can deliver messages swiftly and efficiently.
Started in Stratholme, Zoos are public pens where exotic beasts are taken care of for public spectacle and early conservation is considered.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad crusaders are deeply religious, bordering on zealotry, where churches hold private armies of crusaders ready to pounce at threats and defend church grounds. A small inner barracks of a temple provide lodging and a training ground for these local zealots.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad crusaders are deeply religious, bordering on zealotry, where churches hold private armies of crusaders ready to pounce at threats and defend church grounds. A dedicated barracks, seperate from the church, holds and trains new Crusaders to their faithful militias.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad crusaders are deeply religious, bordering on zealotry, where churches hold private armies of crusaders ready to pounce at threats and defend church grounds. A warrior abbey where a caste of warrior monks and priests reside amongst a deeply pious and well armed force.

Lordaeronian and Hillsbrad crusaders are deeply religious, bordering on zealotry, where churches hold private armies of crusaders ready to pounce at threats and defend church grounds. A crusader's keep where armed crusader officers and captains reside alongside their own private armies.

Chargers were early knights who excelled on the open fields outside the capital city, specializing in counter-cavalry tactics. This open field helps chargers train on the open ground and specialize their units.

Chargers were early knights who excelled on the open fields outside the capital city, specializing in counter-cavalry tactics. A local ranch run by a Charger family who can armor and train new Chargers in relative peace.

Chargers were early knights who excelled on the open fields outside the capital city, specializing in counter-cavalry tactics. A stable where Charger horses are bred and new chargers can be armed from tribal armories and trained in organized fields.

Chargers were early knights who excelled on the open fields outside the capital city, specializing in counter-cavalry tactics. Local fiefdom dedicated to a noble charger family and their retinue, who can field their armies for their owner's cause quickly.
A Lordaeronian shrine, dedicated to a local god. These places are considered deeply sacred.
A mission of the local priesthood dedicated to both evangelicalism and protecting a local shrine.
A shrine covered in a large yurt, where a tribal priest performs rituals in privacy.
A tomb dedicated to a pious hero which illuminates with emotional power, and a literal protective ghost.
A private shrine of a family guild, where only guild members can access to pray and recieve guidance.
A guild owned church, located primarily on guild property, where a well payed priest administers religious rites to the guild members.
An abbey run by guild officials and paid by the guild to provide religious services to the guild and train new priests for the guild's services.
A formal chapel aligned with the guild, and dedicated to a complex relationship of using the guild to spread the true faith, and the guild using it to gain religious support.

Stromic Trollhunters are a long standing tradition, where warriors ride out and slay trolls and other barbarians, specializing in counter raiding. Troll hunting barracks act both as training grounds for the Trollhunters and as dungeons for captured trolls.

Stromic Trollhunters are a long standing tradition, where warriors ride out and slay trolls and other barbarians, specializing in counter raiding. These fortified barracks act as frontline barracks in more dangerous regions, and act as difficult obstacles for raiders and tribals.

Stromic Trollhunters are a long standing tradition, where warriors ride out and slay trolls and other barbarians, specializing in counter raiding. A well fortified series of tent cities surrounding a central barracks, a command post for a unit of elite troll hunters.

Stromic Trollhunters are a long standing tradition, where warriors ride out and slay trolls and other barbarians, specializing in counter raiding. A local headquarters where new troll hunters are not only recruited, but undergo brutal training within it's walls. Indication of screaming trolls is probably a myth.
High hill farmsteads filled with wheat, baily, and hops provides a a decent rural enviornment and steady supply of food for the local capital.
A small, not very rich, farming community based on high ground surrounded by fields of grain.
A village of Stromic families unified in a loose village, specializing in farming and managing their own peasant lands.
A small town surrounded by several villages, covered in fields of grain. This farming community keeps much of the county well fed.

A formal system of complex feudal craftsmen, cottage industries, and farming communities which would become to the basis of other human feudal cultures in the Eastern Kingdoms, perfected and mastered here under the watchful eye of a local overlord.

Arbalests are Stromic riflemen trained by dwarves, acting as skirmishers and masterful upon the open fields of their home country. Their training range is outfitted with some tents in the open country, and a brutal seargent to help train them.

Arbalests are Stromic riflemen trained by dwarves, acting as skirmishers and masterful upon the open fields of their home country. A more elite barracks located in the city where Arbalests are trained and well recieved by their comrades.

Arbalests are Stromic riflemen trained by dwarves, acting as skirmishers and masterful upon the open fields of their home country. Gun mounted forts, normally located outside the city, where range training and lodgings are held, but also acts as a decent defensive point.

Arbalests are Stromic riflemen trained by dwarves, acting as skirmishers and masterful upon the open fields of their home country. A complex of gunsmiths amongst a walled fortification with a dedicated armory, where Arabalests train and are lodged to help garrison the city.
Stromic mines are dug deep into the earth, where minerals are dregged up for war materials.
An organized quarry where stone and other materials are stripped from Azeroth with the purpose of building new defences, walls, and military structures.
A basin of loosely organized resources such as mines, ranches, farms, lumber mills, and smiths which produces both wealth and materials of the driven Stromic military.
An industrial workshop surrounded by smaller resources protected by a small garrison and fueled by a rural town, producing new materials for war and for the market.

Spellweavers are an old school of human sorcerers first trained by the elves, crafting but never really perfecting their spells. Spellweaver towers are commanded by a small mage council and their many apprentices.
Spellweavers are an old school of human sorcerers first trained by the elves, crafting but never really perfecting their spells. A formal guild of Stromic spellweavers to master their craft.

Spellweavers are an old school of human sorcerers first trained by the elves, crafting but never really perfecting their spells. A traditional school where human learn to weave and create spells under strict guidelines and militaristic patience.

Spellweavers are an old school of human sorcerers first trained by the elves, crafting but never really perfecting their spells. An elite acadmy of spellweavers who master their craft and weave in new spells within the walls of a grandoise magical college.

Highlanders are a warband of large weapon wielding warriors who specialize in the hillsides of the Arathi Highlands. A group of tents and fires on a hillside overlook a small clan, acting as defensive warriors and mercenaries for the tribe.
Highlanders are a warband of large weapon wielding warriors who specialize in the hillsides of the Arathi Highlands. A tribalistic village outside the normal tribe made up of highlander families.

Highlanders are a warband of large weapon wielding warriors who specialize in the hillsides of the Arathi Highlands. An informal fiefdom of highlander warriors surrounding a fortified hall, which trains and arms the dangerous Stromic clansmen.

Highlanders are a warband of large weapon wielding warriors who specialize in the hillsides of the Arathi Highlands.A fortified inn surrounding a village where drunken Stromic highlanders converge to tell tall tales of their grim fury.
An Stromic tribal hut where various weapons and banners are stored until war starts.
Stromic clansmen and villagers train in organized training grounds in a opne fields to help hone in their skills and professionalism.
A hall decorated in the heads of Stromic's inhuman enemies, where warriors and chieftains discuss stradegy and tactics.
A long hall worthy of a local Stromic warlord and their family, surrounded by defensive points, barracks, and small armories.

Lancers are a group of mounted cavaliers which use spears to kill cavalry and outmanuever on the open field. This large open field corral is run by a small family of Lancers, helping to train new Lancers in their niche combat.

Lancers are a group of mounted cavaliers which use spears to kill cavalry and outmanuever on the open field. A large stable next to a open hillside field where Lancers train in mounted combat amongst a field of targets.

Lancers are a group of mounted cavaliers which use spears to kill cavalry and outmanuever on the open field. An Stromic mercenary camp where lancers train and house themselves, primarily in the pocket of the guild.

Lancers are a group of mounted cavaliers which use spears to kill cavalry and outmanuever on the open field. A royal unit of Lancers under the formal control of a Lancer noble within the confides of his local keep, but acts informally as a loyal private army for the guild.
Greyguard are an elite regiment of Gilneas, who use a mixture of elite royal infantry and cannon to combat enemies. This barracks stores the armories and lodgings of the Greyguard.

Greyguard are an elite regiment of Gilneas, who use a mixture of elite royal infantry and cannon to combat enemies. A royal barracks which is larger, and supplied with better luxeries and larger apartments.

Greyguard are an elite regiment of Gilneas, who use a mixture of elite royal infantry and cannon to combat enemies. A bleak keep where a militaristic commander lauds over an army of the Greyguard from a fortified position.

Greyguard are an elite regiment of Gilneas, who use a mixture of elite royal infantry and cannon to combat enemies. A large bleak fortress of the Greyguard, filled with armories, barracks, towers, and dungeons.
A small Gilnean workshop which churns out new inventions based on military science and alchemy.
A Gilnean workshop filled with tools and apprentices which tinkers with new technology such as gunpowder for military and civilian purpose.
An industry of laborers from inside the walls a large workshop which quickly produces cheap but effective products.
A sizable industrial quarter of various workshops and innovative alchemy labs which supply a sizable income to the local econemy.

Gilnean Musketeers use slower but easy to produce rifles, which allows them replace most of their bows with gunpowder regiments. Musketeers train in woodlands on small ranges, not all that different from commonplace militia training grounds.

Gilnean Musketeers use slower but easy to produce rifles, which allows them replace most of their bows with gunpowder regiments. Musketeer barracks are wooden lodges with a range and an armory which allows them to formalize their recruitment.

Gilnean Musketeers use slower but easy to produce rifles, which allows them replace most of their bows with gunpowder regiments. Muskteer lodges are private halls owned by a officer who helps train new Musketeers on multiple ranges around the lodge.

Gilnean Musketeers use slower but easy to produce rifles, which allows them replace most of their bows with gunpowder regiments. Muskets are never in short supply, but the Musketeer Armory keeps large amounts of muskets and shot within reach of a system of barracks and lodges to allow quick mobolization.
Gilnean fashion has been described as modern, for only the Gilneans know good fashion.
Black dyes are needed for Gilnean banners and cloths, and is a very lucrative business.
A luxerious tower fit for a wealthy business man or nobleman, isolated in the countryside.
A isolated mansion of a famous writer who makes saucy novels and cultural classics.

Harvest Witches are an ancient druidic order from early human spirituality which survives in Gilnean culture. Harvest circles are small covens where the witches meet and discuss their spells and perform ancient rites.

Harvest Witches are an ancient druidic order from early human spirituality which survives in Gilnean culture. A fenced off dark grove where local druidic circle of Harvest Witches live in and perform their magic in relative isolation.

Harvest Witches are an ancient druidic order from early human spirituality which survives in Gilnean culture. A great grove based around a massive hollow tree where a large cult of Harvest Witches and their servants practice their magic.

Harvest Witches are an ancient druidic order from early human spirituality which survives in Gilnean culture. Haunts are large woodland areas which are deeply cursed and isolated, where a community of Harvest Witches practice magic.
Yeoman are Gilnean archers which use longbows for superior range. A tribal range help train and arm Yeoman for war.
Yeoman are Gilnean archers which use longbows for superior range. Yeoman barracks are more armory then barracks, with a training yard and officers quarters.
Yeoman are Gilnean archers which use longbows for superior range. A large scale range which provides many targets and armaments for Yeoman.
Yeoman are Gilnean archers which use longbows for superior range. A quarters of several veteran Yeomen who help train new regiments in rigerous longbow training.
A hidden grove deep in the isolated forests of a Gilnean tribe, where old worshippers gather.
A haunting forest occupied by a small but influential group of Harvest Witches, worshipping the old faith.
A haunted tribal grove ruled over by a sizable cult of powerful druidic witches, living as an isolated priestly tribe seperate from the local clan.
A walled off cult of Harvest witches and their families who in secrecy perform strange but beneficial rituals.
A large forest clearing bought from nobility for the guild's elite to hunt alongside famed Gilnean bloodhounds.
A guild lodge where the guild's family occassionally hunts game alongside a small army of Gilnean huntsmen and their horde of Mastiffs.
A noble's manor in the countryside, used primarily for hunting and as a vacation home for high end guild members, who mostly go on massive fox hunts through the country.
A stone castle on the outside, but a Bestiary on the inside, a huge playground for Mastiffs and huntsmen of Gilneas to prepare for hunts, or to fight for the guild in trade conflicts.
Dalaranian Sorcerers train in magic from a young age, becoming masters in arcane arts. Dalaran mages live in large towers which they and their apprentices to practice magic.
Dalaranian Sorcerers train in magic from a young age, becoming masters in arcane arts. A magical library, and a pain for apprentices as they try to catch flying books.
Dalaranian Sorcerers train in magic from a young age, becoming masters in arcane arts. A domed citadel with a violet roof, a common place for sorcerers to dwell in and practice or study magic.

Dalaranian Sorcerers train in magic from a young age, becoming masters in arcane arts. A magical dimension which allows safety and room to practice magic within a strange and manipulated universe, built by a cabal of powerful mages.
A mage and smith who lives in a small blacksmith with their magic tools to help forge new enchanted equipment such as staves and wands.
A magical generator used for numberous purposes, such as creating a flying town, burning away the undead, or even creating a powerful barrier.
Dalaran guilds are famed for their specialization in magic and their continued meddling in many political affairs, guild halls act as recruitment grounds and as private quarters to powerful mages.
Dalaranians collect magical artifacts of various strengths for both study and for possible use, with few limitations or restrictions. These relicquaries keep these relics under magical lock and key.

Guardians are gifted heavily enchanted weapons, armor, and gear and guided by battle mage captains in Dalaranian service. Guardian barracks are violet roofed structures with a variety of magical armories to keep Guardians well supplied.

Guardians are gifted heavily enchanted weapons, armor, and gear and guided by battle mage captains in Dalaranian service. The Guardian Arcanium is a magical training ground where mages test the skill and organization of the Guardians with increasingly difficult magical tests.

Guardians are gifted heavily enchanted weapons, armor, and gear and guided by battle mage captains in Dalaranian service. A powerful group of mage smiths live and thrive to make and procure new magical artifacts for the use of Guardian regiments within this large barracks.

Guardians are gifted heavily enchanted weapons, armor, and gear and guided by battle mage captains in Dalaranian service. A flying barracks which covers over the city limits, a island for training new Guardian infantry which can only be accessed via portals.
Dalaranian society is very tolerant and supportive of magical practice, allowing a special quarter for younger new mages to live and study in the city's walls.
A open sewer system beneath the city where rabble and rogue mages hang out. Don't drink the water.
Dalaranians have a long standing history with elves and allow a small enclave or two within their walls, which help teach them and master magic for the small price of sanctuary.
A sizable magical prison where some of the most dangerous enemies of Azeroth are stored in arcane cages to null them. These horrifying enemies can provide useful knowledge for future use.

Invokers are an elite group of casters hailing from Dalaran, using powerful and more effective magical tactics. Invoker towers are large magical structures which are housed by an invoker captain and their apprentices.

Invokers are an elite group of casters hailing from Dalaran, using powerful and more effective magical tactics. Invoker holds are barracks with large courtyards used to train for more devestating spells.

Invokers are an elite group of casters hailing from Dalaran, using powerful and more effective magical tactics. Magical barracks which act partially as colleges, but more for training more skilled and more devestating invoker armies.

Invokers are an elite group of casters hailing from Dalaran, using powerful and more effective magical tactics. A huge magical complex of shifting arcane rooms and apartments where a council of powerful mages gather for discussing magic and training new Invoker regiments.
Witcholoks cast unpredicable, wild spells which works amazingly if they worked properly. A personal occult shrine where crazed wizards gather to discuss their great, and barely working, spells.
Witcholoks cast unpredicable, wild spells which works amazingly if they worked properly. A tribal guild of skilled but mad wizards, performing their arcane arts with explosive results.
Witcholoks cast unpredicable, wild spells which works amazingly if they worked properly. A walled off barracks where witcholoks perform magic, not for their own safety, but for the safety of others.

Witcholoks cast unpredicable, wild spells which works amazingly if they worked properly. A tribal tower where a group of Witcholok archmages train their new apprentices in spells, that thankfully, do work.
Not a traditional human grove, but more like a peaceful garden owned by a local mage to practice spells away from prying eyes.
A alchemist hut in the countryside of the tribe who produces mana potions for a group of mages.
A seperate area of the tribe with a large group of Arcanists who dwell with their families, a seperate by very prestigious class of sorcerers.
A tribal enclave of elite foreign and local mages protected and well treated by the tribe.
A guild dungeon with arcane holding cells used primarily for keeping dangerous enemy mages and evil monsters under arcane bondage.
A private arcane study and practice area for guild members, useful for mastering powerful magic.
A private tower for a powerful rogue archmage and their students, using very unorthodox means to study and perform magic.
A magic academy within guild grounds made for the families of the guild's mages to help study and specialize their magic.
